page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW OF BLOCK
page.content: OUR BLOCK HAS A LOT OF LAND THAT IS ROUGH FELL PASTURE MOSTLY FOR SHEEP GRAZING. THERE IS MOOR LAND GOING UP TO THE HOWGILL FELLS. THE FIELDS ARE SURROUNDED BY DRY STONE WALLS. MOST OF THE GRASS IN THE VALLEY BOTTOM IS CUT IN THE SUMMER FOR SILEAGE AND USED AS WINTER FEED FOR THE CATTLE. THE SMALL VILLAGE OF NEWBIGGIN-ON-LUNE IS NEAR THE FAST BY-PASS ROAD,JOINING SCOTCH CORNER AND THE M6 MOTORWAY. THERE IS ONE POST OFFICE AND SHOP, AND A BUS TO KENDAL ONCE A WEEK ON A FRIDAY AND A MINI BUS ON MONDAY. OTHER PEOPLE LIVE OUT ON FARMS IN THE SURROUNDING AREA.
